title: Good Communication
body: A short while ago I complained about bad communication. Am glad to report that its now fixed up real good. I'm happy about this. Westholme Worthing gets the job done and done well. Very pleased with the staff and senior staff. We'll done westholme clinic Worthing. Keith.

author: Squitty
title: The continued support
body:
My counsellor was brilliant,
I feel I'm not alone
I really can't explain the help and it's effects.
Just speechless and overwhelming when theses key worker efforts

author: JH20
title: Wonderful, caring nurse
body:
I attended Wishaw General hospital for a bone marrow biopsy. I would like to extend my absolute gratitude to the wonderful, caring nurse who carried out my bone marrow biopsy - Jane. On arrival, Jane greeted my wife and I with warmth and reassurance, she immediately put me at ease as I was worried about getting the biopsy. Jane carefully explained how she was going to carry out the procedure, she gave us time to process this. Jane very kindly allowed my wife to be present during the procedure as she understood that my wife‚Äôs support would be crucial at this time. She ensured my comfort throughout the procedure, making my over-all well-being priority at all times. Jane was assisted by Alex who was also extremely caring, kind and reassuring. After the procedure, Jane explained what the next steps would be in a really kind, sensitive and professional way. Jane also phoned me at home in the evening to ensure I was feeling ok, not in any pain and there wasn‚Äôt a problem with my wound, I thought that this was a fabulous example of excellent patient care.  
I will always be so grateful to Jane for her professional skill, her kindness and concern and her lovely, warm personality. Jane is an absolute credit to the NHS, especially as this extremely stressful time. I‚Äôm sure Florence Nightingale would be very proud of this nurse at Wishaw General Hospital.

readBy.name: Elaine Smith's office, MSP for Central Scotland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Dalla
title: How I got the job that I love
body:
I remember it was a super windy day in Rotherham that I needed to hold tight my husband‚Äôs arm to keep equilibrium. I was searching for a job and he wanted a change of his own job. This is why we attended a job fair at Rotherham Stadium.  
With not many options to follow I decided to know more about a table that had a big banner with job opportunities for people with medical problems, either physical or mental problems.  
It was BBO (Building Better Opportunities) run by a quite big team at that job fair. I was assessed by a woman and she explained me about the project requirements and how I will be helped. To be honest, I didn‚Äôt understand much of it at that time. She said also I‚Äôm not a fit for the programme but she will do something for me instead, to help.  
She called Alex. ‚ÄúHe will be your work coach.‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúHe will help you find a suitable job for you according to your skills.‚Äù she continued.  
I didn‚Äôt know what to expect and what to believe. I only knew that they will help me find a job and I need to attend meetings with them for this to happen. Well, I needed to meet Alex.  
Alex contacted me in about a week. We set up a meeting. We met first in Rotherham and he explained in detailed what will happen. I completed enrolment forms and presented my ID, my passport. I understood more about the project but not completely. It seemed unreal someone will help me search for a job. A job, which was not ordinary or randomly picked but it will be according to my skills, experience and personal needs. I was smiling at the end of our meeting and this filled my heart with hope.  
Since then, I and Alex met every week in a day we both agreed, excepting holidays. We started looking for certain positions I would agree and they were suitable to my skills. We build my CV and cover letters. We started applying. At first I wanted a part-time job and because I was dependent on bus, I couldn‚Äôt go further 5 -7 miles from my home, the options were not that many.  
Alex was always calm and never rushed things. He was understanding in any circumstances and wanted for me to get a good job that I will be happy to do it. I learned not only he will help to find me a job but will offer me support for the next 3 months in my new work place to ensure everything is going good for me and I will adapt in, properly.  
Each time we met, I think I began to be more open about me, my job to be and my working needs. I couldn‚Äôt think of any job, because I am a person who can‚Äôt do a stressful work for long. I couldn‚Äôt travel more than 5-7 miles from home because I didn‚Äôt have a car or driving licence and my commute with the bus or even train couldn‚Äôt be longer than one hour. A long commute and a stressful place to work would have jeopardised my health. I did this before and I had to quit too many jobs. I wanted this to work and I begun to trust more the project, and Alex.  
Before being part of BBO and meeting Alex, my work coach, I tried customer service roles, 5 times, it was 7 months I resisted the most of it, I was fired because of an absence, then warehouse, I couldn‚Äôt cope more than 2 weeks or even self-employed acting as Interpreter it didn‚Äôt work, there were too little appointments to interpret for and long distances to cover.  
I think meeting Alex and be part of BBO was my chance here in UK to find the job I was dreaming all this four years I had been here.  
Alex was very receptive to my words, my necessities, my story within work, and the experience, which I consider was little. But, above this I discovered my skills were the most important assets to get me a job I would do it without worrying I wasn‚Äôt able to keep it.  
Now I work as a Content Creator. The role is Bank Staff, which offers me a great flexibility, I can work as much time I can without worrying I will be dismissed. And, what is the best part is that I am doing creative work which suits me the most. I love it.  
Previously I had worked for one year as Graphic Designer in my home country. I was doing banners, flyers, business cards, all sort of promotional stuff. I learned that I enjoyed this job and I developed skills about creating all sort of advertising material. I dared to believe I will do the same work here, in Uk, that I will get a job in graphic design or at least a creative job. I felt was doing well my job at that time and wanted to continue, and even build a career out of it, after moving to Uk. But it was impossible to get that type of job for me without an English certificate/diploma and a portfolio I left in Romania, at my previous employer.  
Alex saw my potential and encouraged me to fulfil my dream, getting a creative job. It was pretty hard as I didn‚Äôt have any piece of my previous works. I could not prove my creativity and ability to work with a computer and software to build products, such as flyers, for example.  
He told every detail I needed to know about the job and asked to collect any evidence of my previous work to be shown to the managers. The job seemed perfect and I didn‚Äôt want to miss it. I offered to do a sample of my work instead of evidence of my previous job. He agreed and sent me text and images for the work I did at home. We strongly collaborated about this. The piece of the work he sent it to the right people and I received good feedback. Later, Alex set for me a meeting with a recruitment manager and we met all 3 of us. I did very well and later I was asked to attend another meeting to sign employment papers.  
We, Alex and I succeeded.  
He, as work coach was completely successful, he found me a job which was perfectly suitable with flexible working hours, and I could do it even by home or travel to the company. He also respected all my requirements about the job. And I secured a job which was my dream come true. I will do creative work and I know I am good doing it. I will do something I love. Just now, for me it is perfect.  
I hope someday will turn into a great career but this depends only on me, now. I am deeply grateful to Alex for believing in me and making my dream job come true.  
This was in October. Soon I learned of a great turnout happened in my life. I become ill. I was facing hard times. By that time I needed to meet Alex, sign the employment papers but I couldn‚Äôt do it anymore. One day Alex called me and I told him the difficult moments I was living. Alex was a great listener and assured me everything will be fine. We talked for more than an hour, he mostly listened to me.  
My words are not enough to thank for what he did for me that time. He also assured me the job I had now will be waiting for me.  
There was a two months break. I feared all our work will be for nothing. But Alex was right, my job waited for me and now I am working.  
I know am at the beginning but I feel that a great work adventure is waiting for me too.  
I am seriously happy.

author: AKCNG79
title: A heartful thank you to all IBD Nurses
body:
Just a little something to say we appreciate all that you do for us as a family and most importantly our son. You have helped us all through some tough times and seen us come out the other side. Without a loving, caring and supportive network of nurses we don't know what we would do without you.  
Please know how much you are appreciated and also know how much you inspire others, so much so I applied to UWS for first steps to Nursing and got in, that is because I have watched all of you for so long and our son's health has improved so now is the time. So from the bottom of my heart and my family, Thank you!! Stay safe üíú xxxx

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: fi scotland
title: Well looked after
body: Mum admitted to hospital last week unable to stand or walk and generally poorly. We were nervous about her going into hospital but did not need to worry she was well looked after and staff were kind and caring whilst getting her back on her feet. They were considerate with us as a family and listened to our concerns.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Fantastic service
body:
I was sent to a&e today through the recommendation of my gp having lived  in Yorkshire for 3 years I have been fortunate not to need this service but during this covid 19 war that this country is facing I had to use the nhs service and have nothing but praise for the workers on the front line.
The staff were amazing very friendly and helpful under such difficult times I cannot praise this hospital enough.
Well done team pinderfields keep up the amazing job you do.

title: Excellent Service
body: I tried to avoid going to A&E under the current circumstances but after 3 days of pain in a damaged foot I had no choice. I was recommended to try Corby Urgent Care before Kettering. There was a line leading into the car park but this soon decreased and I was quickly being "Corona" checked, on the all clear I went straight in to see a nurse who took details of my accident, then with in minutes I was being seen by the Doctor, she was very professional and explained exactly what had happened and the treatment that I needed which was basically to have my leg plastered from knee to toe. I only waited again a few minutes before 2 more nurses wheeled me off to be plastered. I had further treatment in the main ward from again great nurses I personally couldn't fault the cleanliness and the quality of care I received, I not hesitate to recommend and to use this centre in the future. Keep up the good work.

title: Outstanding
body: I had an ectopic pregnancy and was rushed in for emergency same day surgery to remove my left follopion tube. The treatment and care I received was outstanding. I was constantly checked on and treat in a sincerely caring manner by each doctor and nurse I encountered. As for the theatre team, quite simply...fantastic. I was calmed and comforted by the anesthetist and surgeon prior to surgery and the surgery was successful, after care whilst in hospital was great. I think this hospital and how it runs is proof that the NHS isn't failing, the NHS is working in spite of being failed.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: wonderful service
body: I just wanted to say a big thank you to all staff at the surgery.In these awful times of the coronavirus pandemic, you have shown the utmost care to me and my husband. We are both in the category of people who have serious medical conditions. The pharmacy delivered my husbands meds yesterday, many thanks for that. I had a doctors appointment the other day via telephone, which I was grateful for. Thank you for all your hard work.

title: Desperately in need of overhaul.
body:
It‚Äôs obvious that there are significant knowledge gaps across all roles. Procedurally, not clinically. 
Appointments, in my experience have been easy to gain. If I call for an appointment, I am called back within 2 hours. 
My biggest gripe, and upon entering the surgery, the subject I see most people complaining about and that is prescriptions. The Practice are ostensibly entirely comfortable with you running short of your medication. 
They have a banner on their website, committing to a same day turnaround for certain types of medication. However, this simply isn‚Äôt followed. The standard 3 day is rarely followed. In addition, their is a refusal to issue medications before the Practice‚Äôs deemed due date. This date is the 28th day following your previous prescription, which is for 28 days. Therefore, you have no time allowance to gain your medication. For example; if you are to run out of medication on Tuesday and require a new suite of medication from Wednesday morning, the Surgery issues you a prescription on the Tuesday. It may be late afternoon, early evening. You then have to work with the chemist to get your prescription, which, may require ordering in, taking up to 24 hours. Following which; you have to have the time to get to the chemist to collect your medication which you may be unable to do owing to work or other valid reasons. For example, I have mobility issues and in addition to having to have my medication ordered in, I have to to arrange for someone to collect it on my behalf. Therefore, realistically, I need 3 days, at least. That is; the prescription issuing 3 days, PRIOR to the date I need to take the medication. The Surgery ask for plenty of time to prepare your prescription, in fact, they state at least a week. However, patients are given less than a day, to get the prescription to chemist, medication ordered in, prescription made up and arrange to collect it. Previous reviewers on here have commented about the staff believing they are of greater importance than patients, which is, generally ostensibly the case. This is a perfect example of it. You are often greeted with ‚Äúlook, I‚Äôm sorry but we are really busy‚Äù. The classic non-apology. It‚Äôs as though, their workload is the critical factor, rather than patient care. What‚Äôs to say, the patient being admonished by the staff member or GP for not appreciating how busy they are, are not themselves, much busier or under much more pressure. It‚Äôs acknowledged that East Grinstead is lacking Primary Care resources per capita. However, it doesn‚Äôt mean the GP Surgeries have the monopoly on hard work. 
My advice to any patients, struggling as I am; don‚Äôt stand for it and push back hard when you are spoken to inappropriately. These people are present to serve us. There is no doubting the appreciation felt by the public for the NHS, we treat our NHS workers impeccably, in the main. 
Please, please, please, sort out the personnel or system causing the delays with prescriptions.

title: Amazing treatment
body: My mum was due to have her surgery at kings college, but due to the coronavirus it was cancelled until further notice. The surgeon called and said it would be going ahead at blackheath hospital instead on 16/04. We was all very worried, but the hospital was very thorough in ensuring patients were safe from the virus. It was awful that we couldn‚Äôt be with mum due to the virus, but my mum said the nurses were amazing at looking after her and making sure she was alright, it really put my mind at ease. They were also great at calling me to let me know she was out of theatre. So thank you blackheath hospital for taking great care of my mum, and also to the surgeon, who I think was from kings.

author: The Swan
title: Explained all of the risks
body: I was admitted for Angioplasty and Stent during Covid 19 pandemic after being advised of possible risk of infection. Dr Basavarajalah explained all the possible risks involved with being admitted during such difficult times. I was obviously apprehensive but ALL the staff at Heartlands, B'ham, were very calming.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Grateful to on-site dentist
title: Fantastic service
body: Called 111 with toothache. Spoke to a dental nurse who assessed my symptoms and quickly got advice from the on-site dentist. At the end of the call my prescription for antibiotics was sent to my local pharmacy. Fantastic seamless service from the dental team at Nhs24. Thank you!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Jth9066
title: Treatment on ward T4
body: I was admitted to ward T4 for an emergency appendix operation on Friday morning, the treatment and care I received at such a terrible and worrying time. All the staff are amazing and they truly are heroes. To say thank you is not enough. I am exceptionally grateful to you all and everyone working in the NHS at this time‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Bolty
title: Trying to get back into work
body:
Using Good Work run through South Yorkshire Housing Association.  
Had a work coach assigned to me through NHS due to help with my rehabilitation after a brain tumour was removed in October. Alex has help my confidence and motivation in seeking employment. He has also looked at my CV and approached potential employers, helping with applications and interview techniques. He has also helped with moving me towards a new career and I really appreciate everything he and the organisation has done so far. I believe with the help of Good work I will be in employment soon and if not for the Covid-19 situation things would have been sorted earlier but I‚Äôm currently in isolation due to the drugs I am on.

author: MRS MR
title: Mixed experience with staff
body:
I was admitted on ward 8c some months ago.  
I stayed on the ward almost 7 days. Some nurses made my stay lovely, always making jokes and making the patients in bay laugh. Some nurses and sometimes the ward manager would come and greet us in the morning, which I found very nice.  
However, I had an horrible experience with a small number of staff members who I found to be very arrogant and not helpful. While working I heard them gossiping about others, mentioning names and not saying nice things. I felt like they forget that we are sick but not deaf or blind.

author: LMc20
title: Put us at ease
body: My baby was at Douglas Street tonight unwell, seen by Doctor Young. All I can say is thank you your service was amazing at what is the most difficult time. You put us at ease. You doctors and all the workers are amazing, so proud of our NHS service. x

title: Online services
body:
I have used the online services a few times and found them an excellent way to communicate with the practice.
I have used them for ordering medicines, making appointments (closed during COVID 19 pandemic) and particularly the emailing system.  This is a great way to make sure you communicate what information you require from the GP.  They have always responded quickly. This has happened even during the pandemic for which they seemed to be well organised to meet the very challenging situation.  Thank you so much

author: Almart
title: Children‚Äôs ward red zone
body:
On Thursday my son became unwell with a very high temp that wasn‚Äôt staying down with medicine. We phoned the GP for advice. They told us to give more pain relief and it would take a few days to settle. By tea time he was still very hot and we ended having to take him to the GP. I was shocked and frightened in there. No patients, GP covered completely in PPE (rightly so), almost no furniture in the room. It was very hard-hitting. They said he had a cold and was ok so back home we went.  
By the evening he was still not right. Very listless, his breathing was laboured and faster than normal, he was gurning all the time and I was unable to settle him. It was so unlike him and I was starting to get really concerned. Eventually I phoned 111. Due to his high temp we were put through to the covid lines and they wanted to see him at the covid centre. I was terrified, absolutely panicking myself on that drive to the Victoria - the most horrendous scenarios going through my head. The nurses in the covid centre were fantastic. I was shaking and teary but they reassured me and helped me get a mask on and held my son so I could get organised before we entered the building. They could see I was upset and ‚Äòjust got it‚Äô. It‚Äôs amazing how these little things help so much. We were transferred to the red zone which in itself sounds horrific. Not allowed to drive round we were transported by patient ambulance. I was very scared! The paediatric nurse who met us was a friendly face, albeit gowned up. She told me we‚Äôd be ok. She doesn‚Äôt know how much I needed to hear that right there. The nurses and doctors we saw were so friendly, kind and reassuring. They really did just get how I was feeling - alone on the ward with a sick child potentially with covid. Not once was anything too much trouble. There was never any drama or stress and they always had time to check on me, which was very much appreciated.  
It was the worst 24hrs of my life. I‚Äôm so glad that there are so many fantastic people working in our NHS. They are putting others before themselves on the front line to help us all. The mask I had on was terribly uncomfy I‚Äôve no idea how they cope all day in it. Not once did anyone shy away from going near my son despite him being possible covid positive. I applaud you all. The nurses Emily, Ellys, and student Erin were just fab. Thank you NHS. Thank you ladies! ‚ù§Ô∏è  
We are now home. My son is still not right but Covid negative so that‚Äôs a bonus.  
It was scary, I‚Äôm not going to lie but the staff are amazing in what is a difficult time for everyone. The systems at the Vic were very well organised and executed. They are doing their utmost to keep everyone safe.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Dessie
title: My visit after heart attack
body: After being admitted to the ward I was treated very well. The staff did what they could for me and were, on the whole, civil and pleasant, though you could tell they were under pressure and didn't have the time you would normally like them to have. My only real gripe was the food. Regardless of what ward I was in, the food, with the exception of the minestrone soup, was horrible. Not one meal classed as the "healthy option" on the menu available at any of the meal times during my 5 day stay. Surely this should be rectified so to encourage patients to eat healthier.

readBy.name: Elaine Smith's office, MSP for Central Scotland

author: Soulgirl
title: Healthier coping mechanisms
body: So back in August 2018 I lost my husband suddenly and was left on my own with two very young children. Feeling lost and not knowing where to turn I started using cocaine as a coping mechanism. What started as occasional use such as weekends, slowly starting spiralling out of control and my usage became almost a daily consumption. I started to engage with ORB in January and to begin with, I was a bit reluctant and didn't take it all to serious, but the more and more I attended and the more and more I opened up and started talking it then became a new, healthier coping mechanism and life started becoming more manageable and less lonely. I went from being a lost soul to a more confident out going person who could finally smile with purpose. So far I am 9 weeks completely clean from cocaine and alcohol. Thank you to all involved at ORB and all my peers x

author: firsttimedad
title: Birth of our first child
body: It has to be said that almost the entire staff we encountered during our 6 day stay in hospital were amazing. The midwives on the delivery suite were kind, considerate and supportive and made a difficult journey much easier. What I would say is that as the husband, being in theatre during the caesarean I felt somewhat out of control as little information was given as to what was happening (my wife had some complications that meant both delivery and stitching up after was not straightforward). Given I had severe anxiety about the whole birth process due to my mum passing away delivering me, I would have preferred some more frequent information to understand what was happening and why. It would be said that the consultant who performed the surgery was lovely. After recovery we were taken down to the ward where we felt a little abandoned, especially as first time parents, the staff member who we asked for help made us feel a little inadequate but after that the remainder of the midwives, consultants and maternity support workers were brilliant - checking in on us when they didn‚Äôt need to and being very supportive. All but one staff member who came to visit my wife in the very early hours on our second night in regarding concerns over her bowel. The manner was both arrogant and abrupt and greatly upset both myself and my wife, to the point where another staff member ended up coming back into the room to apologise. This person may have expertise and everything may be very simple for them, but to us the situation was both frightening and upsetting - sadly I didn‚Äôt get the staff member's name but I feel they really need to revisit the bedside manner element of training! My only other criticism was the lack of catering for me as the husband - I couldn‚Äôt go home due to not being allowed back because of the coronavirus concerns and so I had to rely on my wife sharing some with me and a few ‚Äúhandouts‚Äù but this should be taken into account as husbands are likely to stay when their partner has had a c section to help and support and due to the lack of sleep etc. we also need to look after ourselves as well by eating well etc. and should not be expected to live out of a vending machine. Other than that the care at Treliske was second to none and we are forever grateful to the midwives, doctors and maternity support workers.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Many thanks
body: I was contacted by phone today, 31st March 2020, at 10am for a prearranged phone consultation from the Urology Dept. This related to a referral made a few weeks ago by my GP. Unfortunately I cannot remember the name of the consultant I spoke to but I wanted to thank him very much for his helpful information and for making the time for that phone call when NHS is so much under pressure with Covid19. Hope all in the Dept are well and staying safe. John McCourt.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent organisation in difficult times
body: I attended an outpatient eye appointment today and was a little anxious due to Coronavirus. I didn‚Äôt need to worry. The department was so well organised and made me feel very safe. Well done to all the caring staff on this team.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous Team
body: From reception, nurses, Admin prescription ladies and Doctors they all give an efficient, friendly, and professional service. They go above and beyond for me personally as I am a very complex patient.

title: Poor service
body: My GP booked the appointment for me, I was then contacted by media an to book an appointment and told them I already had one later on that day they rang me again asking me to book an appointment so I told them I had one only to be told the appointment had been cancelled they didn‚Äôt tell me who by. After checking with my GP they hadn‚Äôt cancelled it. The appointment had been given to some one else. I head my ultra sound and was told that I would get results a week to ten days later and I‚Äôm still waiting. Over two weeks later. I know NHS services are stretched at the minute but this is a private company and the service has been completely unacceptable. I will be reporting this service to CQC for their poor customer service from start.

title: Great practice
body: Used the surgery for years and always been extremely satisfied with the service including fast reaction time and confident advice.

title: Caring Hospital
body:
After a traumatic fall I went to the Minor Injuries Clinic on my birthday of course April Fools Day after falling on my shoulder.
They assessed & sent me for an x ray, nothing broke but it was a soft tissue injury.After two weeks later I returned as it was not getting better.They assured me the x rays were looked at by a Consultant & that they can take longer than an actual break.
I found them excellent in both departments & only spent one & a half hours there totally.It is imperative this hospital stays open to take the strain off the big ones especially in crisis times when travelling has to be minimal.Thank you.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful care
body:
I would like to share how appreciative my family and I are of the care given to my relative who sadly passed away earlier this month having contracted Covid-19. The telephone calls we made to the ward to ask about my relatives daily status were always answered with compassion. The staff, including the nurses and doctors went the extra mile to reassure us. We are especially appreciative of whoever provided an iPad enabling us to see and talk to my relative. Their thoughtfulness will never be forgotten and has made such a difference to coping with our loss. Above all else I praise your hospital for understanding how important it is for relatives to be with their loved one at the end of their life. Being allowed to spend a few minutes with our relative to say goodbye provided comfort to us and I hope our relative could hear us. It will make all the difference to how my family and I make sense of our tragic loss.
Thank you to all staff for your dedication to your patients and your bravery in this pandemic.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazingly thorough and caring treatment
body: I had to go to A&E which I was terrified of in the Coronavirus climate, however the hospital is extremely well organised to take account of the current context. I felt safe and I was given exhaustive tests and examinations to resolve my medical emergency. I was seen by 3 separate doctors and they couldn't have done more to address my current health problems. All the staff, doctors, nurses, porters were caring and compassionate. I am so impressed by the level of care provided by the Lister Hospital and I'd like to thank them all very much.

author: fairy lady
title: Support for depression and anxiety
body:
I was very depressed and had severe anxiety I went to a group therapy at inclusion thurrock for 3 weeks called time for a change with therapists Tom and Chris what wonderful people and it was a pleasure working with them after the group I had my one to one sessions with Chris he was a pleasure to work with after my sessions I am now fully recovered thanks to inclusion thurrock.  
If I ever relapsed I would go back this will not happen hopefully as I have had so much support from Chris through inclusion now I can move forward after having great support from them thanks inclusion for bringing my life back.

title: TRULY OUTSTANDING
body:
MY FATHER SPENT THE FINAL 18 MONTHS OF HIS LIFE IN THIS OUTSTANDING CARE HOME . THE " TRUE CARE , FRIENDSHIP AND LOVE " GIVEN BY ALL THE STAFF WAS WAY BEYOND ANY PRICE .
WE EXTENSIVELY RESEARCHED BEFOREHAND AND WITH DADS FULL INVOLVEMENT AND AGREEMENT CHOSE THE ANTOKOL CARE HOME . THE SERVICE EXCEEDED OUR EXPECTATIONS . THE CARE GIVEN TO ALL RESIDENTS IS BEYOND MEASURE , EVEN IN THESE VERY CHALLENGING TIMES . WE HAVE NO HESITATION IS RECOMMENDING ANTOKOL AND THIER AMAZING STAFF . CARE , WAY ABOVE ANY PRICE . THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR HEARTS . XX

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I had to call the Enderley Road Medical Centre on 6 April 2020 as prior to that I was stressed out and my anxiety was very high. Could not get any sleep at night - stayed wide away during nights. Felt high body temperature but when measured it was within the normal range, around 36.5 degrees
I started have paracetamol, felt very uneasy. When I contacted the medical centre, spoke to the receptionist. She was very polite and listened to all the points I mentioned to her and requested if a doctor can call me whenever one is free. I know there were more serious cases due to Corona virus and all the doctors had to give priority to those.
However, a very nice doctor called me within no time. I explained the situation and mentioned all the points I had written down. The doctor was very nice and polite.
The doctor explained to me that lots of people are suffering due to anxiety and having sleepless nights due to stress. I was told to take everything easy and relax. I was sent a text message straightaway regarding anxiety etc. which I had not received.
Since the chat with the doctor I started feeling relaxed, did some breathing yoga and started feeling better. At night gradually started sleeping. Sleepless nights getting less and less. I am very thankful to the doctor. All the staff - all the doctors, nurses, receptionist everybody is doing a grand job.

title: Still as Charming and Cheerful as ever
body: My problem was handled very swiftly and seamlessly. Given the constraints of Covid 19, I have no complaints. I was glad that I had a wheelchair pusher with me though.

title: Amazing service
body: Contacted the surgery at 8.40am today by email and after having an email and then a text message, had a message from the pharmacy to say my prescription was ready for collection. Amazing, thank you so much.

title: 5 Star Treatment
body: To all you lovely Doctors thank you so much for your kind, caring and lovely advice and treatment which due to the coronavirus has had to be over the phone. I also think that the Receptionists and nurse's deserve special mention as the Receptionists seem to get a lot of stick as front line staff which is quite rediculous as they always treat you with respect and make such a difference when you are feeling poorly. Also as a cleaner myself never take it for granted how immaculate the setting is. Finally a thank to the medical secretaries who supply a great support facility for their respective Doctors. Karen & Dave Shelmerdine.

title: OUR AMAZING MDGH
body:
Although I have stated this review is for ICU I also have to mention my care on Ward11 and Ward12. Ambulance crew took me into MDGH on the 28.3.2020 where I was diagnosed with covid 19.Staff on Ward 11 did everything they could but I was later moved to ICU where the decision to put me on a ventilator was taken.My family could not visit but they were kept very well informed about my condition.The day came when they were told to prepare for the worst.I cannot imagine what they went through particularly with lockdown preventing them from being with each other.
Amazing care and dedication for days from all staff saw me come off the ventilator and regain breathing for myself.The ventilator had done its job.It breathed for me so my lungs could rest and 
recover.
I was moved to Ward 12 where the staff helped me to start being independent. After a few days I was said to be fit to go home. 
The weakness I am experiencing is nothing I have had before.I am still breathless and the hospital are in touch daily to discuss my development. Our specialists are accumulating knowledge daily about Covid 19 and take this very seriously.
I want to thank,thank and thank the MDGH for giving me back to my family and friends. This is my positive experience of the care and dedication from all staff who work for the NHS.They are doing a great job under extreme circumstances.WE SHOULD BE VERY SUPPORTIVE AND PROUD OF OUR NHS.üåàüåàüåà Thankyou

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Prompt courteous service
body: Following a fall 8 days before which damaged my ankle and was slow to heal I contacted the Minor injuries Dept. and was given an appointment the same day. on arrival, I waited a short while until a very friendly and efficient nurse dealt with me. She sent me through for X Rays which were carried out quickly. Back to the nurse who reassured me that she could not see a fracture, but this would be reviewed by a consultant at Salisbury hospital and if necessary they would contact me directly. Given the NHS advice sheet for sprains. Great service the NHS at its best

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Audiology help
body: I am isolated in Kent away from home and sent an email asking for batteries and some plastic tubes for the hearing aids. I had a prompt and helpful response by return and the items are in the post. Excellent friendly service  thank you

title: Extremely professional
body: 2 open heart surgeries in 2 days. Nurses are amazingly professional and made my stay a pleasure. Restored my trust in professionals.

title: Very Caring practice
body:
All the staff from reception to doctors are very caring. Even in these difficult time they are responding to consultations with the doctor. Advising us to stay healthy and ways to protect us from Coronavirus with lots of valuable messages.
It is good to know that some one is there to listen to your problems and calm us down. 
Our family is lucky to have excellent medical service from premier medical centre. 
Thank you all doctors and staff.
Sikendar

title: ED Attendance Today
body: Thank you so much for treating my little girl after she managed to sustain a dislocated elbow today. We were screened (for COVID symptoms) outside, shown to the ‚Äòcold‚Äô ED- treated swiftly, reassured throughout (I really didn‚Äôt want to take her to hospital in the current climate) and discharged, all within 30 minutes. Can‚Äôt thank them enough!

title: Thank You Priorslegh!
body:
Hello,
I have recently been seen by one of your Locum Doctors, for approximately the past few months. I can not thank her enough for providing such a caring and compassionate service, whilst ensuring that everything was followed up efficiently and always updating me once she has completed it. She has checked in on my progress and has enabled me to be able to trust her judgement with my care. 
It makes such a significant difference to a patient to be able to have a consistent support network. Many thanks for your commitment and  dedication. Lindsay

title: Fantastic hostpital
body: I was referred here to have my mastectomy on 14/4/2020 under the circumstances with the added pressure of covid and having a cancer diagnosis. I can honestly say the staff were brilliant caring and nothing was to much trouble  from walking threw the door to the operation and being discharged the same day .

title: Excellent care
body: Recently underwent emergency cardiac surgery. Wonderful care and treatment from all staff and doctors. Highly recommended.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing maternity team
body: From the minute I arrived for my induction until I left with my baby they were amazing. You just cannot fault the maternity department here. The time, dedication and patience each midwife has with you and to your individual needs is outstanding. They looked after me so well and these midwives work there absolute socks off they do not get a second to do anything other than constantly be at every single patients side. I am in awe of them all and what they do. I will forever be grateful for them especially those who were with me during my labour  and who took care of me From then until I returned home. They need more recognition, real life superheroes.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great staff
body: Procedure such as termination is one that is stressful and nerve wrecking for I‚Äôm sure all women who undergo it. However at Marie Stopes, you‚Äôll feel so comfortable with the staff, from initial consultation via phone to the day of treatment at the clinic. They listen to you and understand it‚Äôs fully your choice and won‚Äôt judge or be rude at all. I had the medical abortion last year and was so stressed, but honestly the nurse at the Hillingdon branch was so nice and comforting. I thanked her so much for making me feel less anxious and that it‚Äôs ‚Äúokay‚Äù to feel or do what I am. You guys really help women who are face the unwanted pregnancy dilemma. Thank you so much!

author: Couchie bear
title: Fantastic job at A&E
body: I was sent to A& E after my husband had rang 111 after he had spoken to someone he was told that my gp would ring me up and that it could take up to 2 hours as they were very busy, which I can fully understand. About two minutes later my phone rang and it was the gp, after all the questions they asked me if my husband could take me to A& E and could he go to the gp's to get a letter. So we went to get the letter then went to A& E where they were waiting for me, they give me a mask to wear then took me around the back exit where I had to say goodbye to my husband, again I fully understand why. Then the doctors took bloods and asked me lots of questions and took me for an X-ray after which they put me on a ventilator which helped with my breathing. When my bloods came back the doctor said he was sorry but he would have to take blood from my arteries, which he did then he came back and said sorry again but he needed to redo the test. I wasn't happy as it's very painful but I agreed and he then came back and explained why I was so dizzy and light headed and had no energy. I was aloud home but I need to go back in soon but I was so happy that the doctors had finally found out what is wrong with me after six months of going back and to the doctors. The A& E department did a fantastic job and I thank them very much

author: Boomer2020
title: Can't talk to anyone anymore
body:
I have followed the guidelines on the Princes Avenue surgery web site and use the Engage Consult service because no appointments are being accepted currently. That was first-thing Friday. The confirmation email says I should get a call within an hour but wait two hours to call the surgery if no one calls. I leave it until Monday 3pm (15 working hours) and call the surgery. On hold for over 15 minutes and give up,  
In summary, I can't go online and book an appointment. No one calls back when using the Engage Consult service. No one answers the phone when you call the surgery.

author: Mobydick
title: Cardiologist and radiotherapy
body:
After being seen by a Dr cardiologist for chest pain was told they were 99.9% sure my heart was healthy. After complaining to my local GPs for 2yrs about ongoing chest pain to be told by a GP it was due to my anxiety, which I knew wasn't the case. After further complaining to my GPS, I was seen by a 3rd GP who eventually got the ball rolling and was given a 2nd appointment with the Cardiologist again where was told same thing heart was healthy.  
After explaining myself about lifestyle the cardiologist agreed to get me sent to radiology for MRI scan to have a dye inserted into the heart to see if any possibility of start of clot to which was cancelled due to Corona 19 to which I can understand ,where I'm going with this is, does it need to get to the stage where I could possibly be blue lighted to Edinburgh with suspected heart attack? where if this does end up the case ud think since hospitals are actually empty at this moment in time they could be getting myself and 1000"s more to get problems dealt with before it's matter of fighting for ure life or death.  
Hope anyone reading this can totally understand my frustration thru all of this, as I'm here a was also given MRI an ct scan to be told results were fine only to be phoned a week later to tell me I have COPD,  
Can't understand why these specialists can be missing important results it's totally wrong .

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: LCCadmin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Solihull Parenting Programme
body:
Parent has written that the biggest difference Solihull has made is "it has been able to allow me to use the tools and think about how my child may be trying to communicate with me.  
It is a lovely session by two very lovely, supportive, non-judgemental ladies :)"

author: LCCadmin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Solihull Parenting Programme
body:
Parent has written that the biggest difference Solihull has made is "my son will now sleep through the night, I've only had one bad night in five weeks.  
I have really enjoyed doing this course, I didn't think I would."

author: metronome
title: Family Service really helpful
body:
It was a fantastic service for when our young adult had first come out as a substance abuser. We felt we had somewhere to explain what was happening, what the options were for recovery what our role was and just general support for us as parents It was invaluable and to know it's there if we go through a relapse we can't handle is amazing. We also found the support group with other parents/carers really helpful too and didn't feel quite so alone, floundering or not able to talk about it!  
It's an amazing service.  
I would say the only thing that would have helped us even more would have been an opportunity for counselling with our young person, to be able to talk, share feelings and thoughts, plans and ways through, through a situation where the conversation was supported and guided to develop a way of talking as a family.

author: JayBoy1
title: A superlative and much-needed service, for me and others
body:
I have been attending Inclusion in Alershot for some time now, and have found my regular meetings - Stepping Stones on Mondays, and Wednesday pm ACT (?) - to be really valuable, especially Pete's Monday meetings as it really sets me up well for the week ahead.  
Yesterday, Pete really excelled himself: whilst admitting to not exactly being a techy, he successfully set up a complete Stepping Stones meeting online, which is exactly what I needed.  
It gave me (again) a great start to the week; the chance to speak to other addicts/alcoholics; and to reconnect with the people I had got to know face to face.  
I don't know how long it took to organise, but Pete invited me by email, called me on Sunday to remind me, and ran the meeting brilliantly under very different circumstances.  
All in all, I am grateful for his service during lockdown as I am also grateful to the whole of Inclusion Aldershot and the NHS in too.

author: Kags
title: My Mum's recent admission
body:
I was very wary of an admission to hospital for any loved one during the COVID-19 crisis because of the no visiting policy.  
Mum took ill during the night and pressed her emergency buzzer. A carer came out as per procedure and found her in bed vomiting into a bucket. She has long-term GI issues due to radiotherapy for cervical cancer years ago so this is not the first time this has happened. I was called at 4.30 am and asked to make my way to her supported accommodation - the carer said Mum had had two seizures while they were there and that an ambulance had been called.  
When I got there the paramedics were there and told me they had witnessed a further seizure and would advise she went to hospital for further investigation of this. Her DNACPR is taped to her fridge as she is adamant that she does not want resuscitating but the paramedics said it was out of date and they couldn't accept it. As I was not allowed in the ambulance to go to hospital with her I found that very distressing and told them so.  
Mum then went to hospital - QEUH Glasgow. I waited for a call to ask for some history and let me know where she was. I had to call at 11.30 and go through switchboard and admissions to find out she was in ARU3 and had been since 9am. I phoned there and was told Mum was settled with no further vomiting since admission (which Mum later confirmed was not true). I asked if the reports of seizures had been passed on and the nurse said the bloods had not shown any seizures. I checked the staff knew my Mum was registered blind and said she needed her hearing aids in. I was asked if Mum was a falls risk and I said she had a history of falls and severe osteoporosis well documented in her history. The nurse seemed happy to tell me everything was fine but I felt they did not have all the information i'd asked for with regards to my Mum.  
I got a call later saying Mum was going to 8D in 15 minutes. The nurse said Mum had asked to call me but had informed her to do it upstairs as they have better reception.  
When Mum got to 8D she called and told me she had been vomiting frequently since admission and had anti-sickness medication 3 times. She hadn't seen a doctor there yet so I said I would call the ward in the morning.  
I called the ward the following morning and was told Mum still hadn't seen a doctor so I asked if a doctor could call me after she had been seen as I wanted to ask about the seizures.  
Mum phoned me about an hour later and said she was being discharged so I called the ward and left a message to say they would need to restart her care package.  
10 minutes later I got a call asking me to come and collect Mum and take her home. I asked how that was supposed to work when family are not allowed in - I said I really wasn't happy about being asked to do that given that I couldn't visit when it mattered most to me! The nurse said they would speak to the charge nurse and then came back and said to meet at the front door. I got another call after that asking me to reinstate the care package which I refused to do as that is part of the hospital discharge responsibility as its not a private contract but a HSCP responsibility.  
I waited 40 minutes outside to pick Mum up and was then asked to go to the door as the nurse would not come to the drop off area.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Elaine Smith's office, MSP for Central Scotland
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Lwest
title: Buzzer removed
body: My Mother is on ward 204 and nurse removed the call buzzer from my ill mother, buzzers going unanswered for over 40 minutes before this.

title: Great Surgery
body:
Been with this surgery since it began.  Have always found the doctors and nurses caring and understanding and the reception team efficient and helpful. 

Have already recommended one or two patients and they too are more than satisfied with the service provided.

When I was very Ill two years ago, the doctors and rapid response team treated me at home for nearly 8 weeks.  

The continuing care of the surgery staff is very much appreciated. 

I hope that, during this very difficult period (Covid-19 outbreak) that the staff are able to stay safe and well.

title: Confidential information discussed at Reception
body: My premature 12 week old daughter was attending for her innoculations. My wife also wanted to discuss her weight. Due to the COVID situation I was asked to wait in the waiting room and overheard the receptionist and another member of staff discussing my child's issues at the desk and giving the impression that we were causing a hindrance by raising the issues regarding her weight. I am not sure if cases should be discussed between staff at a reception desk with other people in hearing distance in public waiting room?

title: Amazing service
body: I‚Äôm in isolation re the Corona virus, age 77. The surgery have not been informed of this. Nobody knows .  Amazing.... my phone rang today... enquiring if I was ok and have I got my medications. I‚Äôm amazed at this unexpected care and great service. Well done and thank you

title: Fantastic Service from start to finish
body:
I called the surgery at 10.15hrs, arrived at 10.45hrs as a waiting patient, saw the doctor at 11.20hrs.
Picked up my prescription at around 12.00hrs and took my first dose at 12.15hrs.
Do not knock the Practice, GP's or NHS, unbelievable service.
Footnote: The Gout is improving! (Like the pun?)

title: My GP appointment this afternoon
body: I am 65 years old, this afternoon I had an appointment with the doctor. She was much more thorough than I am used to. I felt very well cared for. I left feeling very happy. Thank you so much to both GP and support staff.

author: Airdrie patient
title: In debt to the Phenomenal Cardiac team
body:
Yet again our family is in debt to the cardiac team in Glasgow!  
Firstly We would like to thank Mr Peng and the theatre team for their skills and knowledge in looking after our daughter!  
Then we move onto the PICU ! Within this ward are the most amazing bunch of people, who always go above and beyond ! Infection control standards are of the highest we have ever witnessed and a special mention to Phyllis the domestic who is a credit to her team ! The doctors and nurses in the PICU are amazing and don‚Äôt always get the credit they are due.  
Then we move to 1E ! Sister Bell and her team are phenomenal ! They are a hard working team who always have time for patients and parents! We always received a high standard of care within the ward. The ward rounds are always well organised and a clear plan is always made and the team always listen to our input !  
So thank you to everyone!!

readBy.name: Elaine Smith's office, MSP for Central Scotland

title: A truly outstanding Doctor.
body: Throughout my husband‚Äôs illness and subsequent to his sad death, one particular doctor has shown an exceptional level of professionalism, empathy,and an extremely high standard of care. Her clinical curiosity and personal touch have been really appreciated. Myself and my family hold her in the highest regard. We are so lucky to have a Doctor of her calibre at Danebridge.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Phenomenal
body:
.y daughter was admitted as an emergency due to undiagnosed diabetes.  She wasn't  too far from a diabetic coma. As you would expect the staff  treated my daughter, but they were  phenomenal, from the staff  who  seen her in A&E  to the ward staff.   My daughter was in the high dependency unit in the ward, she was being checked every 30mins to every hour for 36  hours straight.  While doing this   they managed to reassure both of us, showed endless patience  and care, ( they even phoned up on their days off to find out how she was doing)  and encouraged her to keep  fighting when she wanted to give up.
When she was at her sickest they managed to make her smile. 
 A massive thank you to everybody  in A&E and on Kipling ward especially,  including the domestic staff (who were also great with her) .  They are special people who  feel its  'just their job'.  Not in my book, absolute Angels.   Above and beyond!!

title: Fantastic service
body:
I would just like to give the up most credit to all our Rawnsley surgery/pharmacy staff . Thankyou all for all your hard work ,looking after our health during the Corona virus . Your all truly amazing through this stressful period. And appreciated muchly. 
Thankyou x

title: Feedback on new website
body:
I think your new website is excellent on our Windows 10 desktop.
It works well on my little IphoneSE, but I prefer to use my 8 year old IPad,
Your note today 21/3/20 on the email telling me..
"If the link on this email does not work Copy it and Paste into your browser"
Works well on my old IPad BUT ONLY IF I DO NOT USE SAFARI, (which is Apple's own browser)

When I use Google it works fine.

I was just about to spend a lot of money replacing the IPad, now I do not need to.

SUGGESTION. 
If you can amend the instruction on the email instruction to suggest trying a different browser if the first attempt does not work.

title: So kind and helpful
body: I have had a difficult few months, partly because of my husband‚Äôs health concerns, and my own health, recently suspected Covid infection which made feel very weak and ill.  On two occasions I had help from the doctors, one telephone call and more recently a video consultation.  Both times I was reassured and given good advice.  Their kindness and understanding cannot be surpassed.  Thank you.

title: Thank you NHS for your care and dedication
body: I have various appointments for different conditions at the moment. I have always received exemplary care. The consultants, doctors,nurses, health care assistants etc have been professional and caring. This review is more of a big thankyou  for all you do for your patients. I know that it is extremely difficult and challenging circumstances in all our NHS hospitals due to Covid  -19. If I could I would love to thank each and everyone involved, you all have various roles and expertise and this thank you is for ALL staff. I pray that you receive all the PPI and support to carry out this immense service in such pressing times. Keep safe and we are indebted to you for your care and service. A very grateful patient. xx

readBy.name: The Queen Elizabeth Hospital Kings Lynn NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great blood service
body:
Arrived and was well looked after from the covid nurse on reception through to the team taking the blood. Virtually no wait at all and a very friendly team.
Thank you all

title: Great Doctors, unhelpful reception
body: Cannot fault the doctor's I've seen but it's always the same response from the receptionists, not the most helpful when it comes to booking an appointment. I always try and book online to avoid having to speak to them.

title: Heart attack and cardiac arrest
body: After developing chest pains on a day out with my wife, I attended A&E at 12:45 on 2nd Oct. The triage nurse found my ECG to be abnormal and took me through to a Doctor. He examined me and confirmed there was a problem, then went to make a phone call. I then suffered a heart attack followed by cardiac arrest. My wife called the doctor back and he immediately commenced CPR until a defibrillator was in place. My heart was successfully re-started and I was sent to William Harvey Hospital, Ashford, for an emergency operation to have 2 stents inserted. After 2 nights in CCU, I have now returned home and have been told that damage to the heart muscle is likely to be minimal, due to the prompt actions of the Doctor. Although I cannot remember his name, we will never forget his actions and skills. Words cannot express my gratitude, but I would very much appreciate you passing on our entire family's sincere thanks to this Doctor and all of the staff involved. Thank you.

title: Thank you
body: Thank you to everyone for all your hard work at this difficult time. You have still managed to maintain your professionalism, compassion, dignity and helpfulness while trying to cope will this Corona virus.  Everyone has still managed to remain kind, helpful and treated us with dignity and respect. This is a superb practice we are so lucky as patients.

title: Wonderful NHS staff
body: I was taken to hospital via ambulance, unsure if I had Coronavirus, I was unsteady and the paramedic lady held my hand into the hospital, to help me, everyone who came near me wore PPE but no one made me feel contagious. Every member of staff was wonderful to me and really helped me, luckily it was a viral infection and laringitas. They had been working continuously with patients and still treated me kindly and respectfully. It was very heart warming the care I was given in ambulance and in hospital. It is about time the NHS staff wages were increased severely. They are saving lives every single day. Heroes deserve more.

title: Just to say thank you
body:
We would like to say thank you to Alnwick Medical Group for the care and support they have shown to our family and our father over the past 2 weeks. These are unprecedented times due to Covid-19 but we want you to know we are extremely grateful to you. 

We know that it is in times of greatest need that people‚Äôs emotions can, and do run high, but you have been extremely supportive and responsive to our family‚Äôs needs and providing a professional response and the level of care required under a very difficult time for you all.
Thank you everyone

title: Human compassion
body:
On the occasions I have used the BRI often with trepidation & worry I have always found human compassion & understanding at the fore of the service, people genuinely caring out the skills & tasks of there vocation with enthusiasm & professionalism!  At this grave time of covid 19  we should all salute everyone that
Works in the service ........ by the way I was diagnosed with ‚Äúbird keepers lung ‚Äú & through there help I can now again breath . Thank you

readBy.name: University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

title: Grateful Thanks
body:
A most sincere thank you to the good doctor (and reception staff)  who so promptly saw and examined me yesterday. She greatly alleviated my fears and anxiety as I thought my symptoms were related to my lymphoma.
With every good wish and keep safe.

title: Great practise
body: Staffs brilliant, always try to help the nurses are the best there as well as the doctors always smiley faces.

title: Compliments for care provided to my late mother
body:
I would like to extend our gratitude and thanks for all the care you provided my late mother. My whole family would also like to extend their thanks. My mother has also left behind a 9 year old adopted son and he would also like to say ‚Äòthank you for looking after mummy and we appreciate it‚Äô.

This is a truly trying and challenging time and I know you all worked flat out during my mother‚Äôs admission.

I would specifically like to highlight the excellent nursing care that was provided to my mother. It was dedicated, and kind and of a high quality. This was in the face of huge pressures caused by the pandemic. They were all absolutely fantastic and a credit to the nursing profession.

I would also like to extend my thanks to the doctors, consultant and juniors. The ward clerk was also very patient and understanding fielding my daily phone calls for updates.

Thank you again. I am also a surgical registrar on the north east London rotation and I hopefully may be a future colleague. It‚Äôd be a true honour to work with you all.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: I have been with this surgery for over 16 years and have always had great treatment from all doctors I have seen and the front of house staff are lovely and helpful.

title: couldn't ask for more.
body:
I would like to praise the efficiency of your emergency eye department today.
I am an ex pt experiencing symptoms.
Checked out website given Covid-19, phoned spoke to a sister and then 10 mins later a consultant completed a consultation over the phone
Prescription written and drops in my hand within the hour.

Couldn't ask for more. Responsive and professional.
Praise to all.

Excellent service

title: Most helpful
body: Concerns surrounding contacts and infection during the current Covid-19 crisis  prompted me to request help in setting up on-line prescription requests for myself and my husband. The Surgery staff were most helpful in sorting it all out.

title: Interventional Radiology
body:
Have received wonderful care from the team in the pink zone in Bay 1 of  interventional radiology a few days ago.
Honestly, can‚Äôt tell you how much you‚Äôre all appreciated.
Thank you for taking care of me and all you do.
‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

title: Amazing
body: Our dad passed on the 6th of April and due to the covid19 me and my family were unable to be with him during his last hours, however the staff of what was ward 32 at the time were fantastic and we can't thank them enough :)

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: First Class
body: Many thanks for the superb service I encountered recently  in the Emergency Department.  From Reception to Triage, treatment and overnight stay the entire team provided care, humor, great skill and thorough professionalism.  I feel we are lucky to have such a wonderful service on our doorstep!

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you
body:
After a GP referral I went reluctantly to Whiston A and E. 
I found it welcoming and clean- I was given a mask to protect me and  others during the Corona virus. I was triaged pretty straight away and then saw the same nurse/ Doctor for further tests- bloods etc. Although I had to wait in between the tests it  wasnt that bad. 
The staff were patient- Im a little hard of hearing! They talked me through my health condition and symptoms and gave me advice for when I got home.
They were excellent, patient, professional and knowledgeable. 
If I need A and E again, Whiston is the place I would definitely go.
A big thank you to all of the staff, you're brilliant!

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: "Above and Beyond"
body:
I have been a patient at Parkside practice for about 25 years and have always found all the staff, reception, nurses and doctors to be1st Class.
Yesterday, being of a certain age and in view of the current crisis, I asked if it was possible to have a consultation without visiting the surgery, a doctor (unfortunately I am not allowed to name Her / Him) called me back within 5 minutes from their own home. The doctor was professional, polite, caring and cheerful, was extremely thorough in  their investigation, diagnosis and advice. I was given all the time I needed and in minutes a prescription was emailed to my chemist. All in all "Above and Beyond" the call of duty.
My deepest thanks to Parkside please all stay safe your 1st, Class.

author: patquilt
title: stroke rehabilitation
body:
At the beginning of the corona virus the paramedics took me to City Hospital to the stroke unit. I was sorted out by all sorts of people. They checked me over and checked my neck and checked my blood pressure and gave me something to eat. They had their uniforms but they didn't have extra protection at all.  
I came home that evening and my daughter stayed with me because I'm supposed to be my husband's carer. My daughter helped with the food and got all the information.  
The nurse at the GP surgery gave good advice too.  
Abi came and was very thorough and then Natalie came the next day. They were very nice to have in our home and I was very glad they came out.  
I feel I've had the attention I would probably have had before.  
Abi and Natalie and Margaret have all phoned and followed things through to check that I'm doing the right thing.  
They are all fantastic, they've done very well indeed.

title: The worst experiance.
body:
I've been with this practice since I moved to Folkestone over 10 years ago, and up until last year I'd never had any issues, but maybe that's due to never really needing to go to them.
May 2019 I went there to talk about my mental health and how I could take positive steps to improve it. I got the opposite to this. I no longer wish to talk to anyone about my struggle with depression after I was laughed at and told to go and talk to my parents. And yes, maybe I should talk to my parents but even as I showed a discomfort in that I was pressured to. And I'm not exaggerating when I say laughed at. This practice needs serious help.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Fantastic service!
body:
Having used the online "consultation room" for the first time, I for one couldn't be happier!

My query was dealt with much quicker than I had an anticipated under the current circumstances, and a prescription sorted the same day. 
It is services like this (where appropriate), that are tremendously helpful to us that are juggling key worker jobs, and family life etc 

Well done to all at the surgery for your hard work.

author: Thankfully patient
title: The care my wife received during her last days
body:
My wife unfortunately was at the end of life due to cancer. The care and support that my wife received was without any shadow of a doubt the finest care anyone could hope for the nurses went above and beyond to make not only that my wife was comfortable but made all my family feel supported and nothing was a bother for them from the doctors to the nurses and auxiliaries I can not thank them enough. A special thank you to the nurses who were with me at the end for the way they looked after myself and my wife I will not forget their kindness. I would like to take this chance to wish them all the best for the future and once again say thank you.  
TO THE STAFF OF THE GYNO WARD AT CROSSHOUSE HOSPITAL IN KILMARNOCK.

readBy.name: Office of Joan McAlpine, MSP for South of Scotland

author: Nkx
title: Thank you to all involved in the birth of my first baby
body:
I just wanted to write to say thank you to all involved in the birth of my first baby - a little girl.  
I came into triage on the Sunday morning thinking I had gone into labour, however I wasn't too far along, I was given advice and sent off.  
I later had to return as I had a bleed. On arrival I was met by a lovely midwife who kept me calm, and reassured me while working out why I was bleeding. When checked i was 4cm, and my waters were just waiting to be broken, I was told I'd be the next one into labour ward where my partner could join me. (Due to covid 19 he wasn't allowed in until this point)  
In the labour ward, I was under the care of Margaret who got to know us, and kept us going throughout the whole process. She remained calm when our heart began to dip, and offered an episiotomy to support babies delivery when we knew we had to get her out. Baby was born at half 6, which meant I was then handed over to another member of staff at 7 o'clock. Zoe was great, and really kept us calm when I fainted twice while still under her care, not only did she get me the help I needed but she reassured my husband.  
These two ladies really did make my experience remain calm and positive despite all that is happening in the world.  
I also want to say a thank you to the ladies in Ashgrove ward, who were fantastic but particularly to Olivia who gave great support throughout in my time there.

title: 20 years plus fantastic care
body:
I have been attending this clinic for over 25 years and have always received fantastic service.  They have excelled themselves during the coronavirus period.  I have been able to obtain same day telephone consultations regarding other health issues, with the calls always returned promptly as promised.

I have always found that I can be seen the same day when the need arrises which is very rare to receive.

Thankyou all at Walm surgery.

title: Went like clockwork.
body: Visitd both Porters Avene and Harold Wood clinics for separate scans and was seen immediately, and I was early. Minimum of fuss quick,efficient and friendly and out in no time at all.I would highly reccomend both clinics.

title: Ultrasound appointment
body: Extremely professional service. Seen on time and staff wearing PPE made me feel totally comfortable with the current situation. Was in and out of appointment within half hour.

title: Superb care from this practice
body:
The owner of the practice: He was superb, sorted my problem out in an instant. it is still ongoing but I am now getting there.
Senior male nurse, know's who he is I hope, he was the STAR in all of this, sorting out my daughter's problem, he organized drugs and had them sent to my home in an instant. I can not thank him enough and when this is over I will. He was absolutely superb! He genuinely cares about his patients.
The young lad in the dispensary, superb, listened empathized and sorted, amazing understanding for such a young age, no lipservice with him, he genuinely cares about his patients
The lady on reception, tried to sort and helped me find the right person to sort my daughters problem, she was amazing, thank you for helping me.
The guys who are our delivering all these prescriptions, they are so good and nothing is to much trouble for them.
When people moan about waiting to get through we all now have to understand that these people are doing their very best, risking their own health, we might be scared about catching this virus but imagine how they feel.
 I can not thank them enough, they have taken so much stress from me and my daughter who has a serious immune problem. Thank you for delivering such superb service in such horrid conditions. Please all stay safe.

title: Excellent Service
body: I am at high risk, and I mean the highest :-).  I am due to have my regular monthly blood test but I am so fearful to leave my home incase the covid 19 monster attacks me. My most compassionate GP knows of my fear and arranged for me to have my blood test done in the car because I wanted to cancel it and she knew how important it is for me to keep my appointment.. I am over the moon and I am feeling so blessed to have such as compassionate GP.  She even called me today instead of tomorrow a day earlier for my telephone consultation because she heard I wanted to asked her a question. Thanks doctor. I love you to bits. Please take care. I cant afford anything to happen to you also your family. I told you once that if you were to go on holiday I would put my illness on hold :-) until you return.. I wish I could :-) and if you were to leave there to  go to another surgery i would be right behind. Happy Easter Doctor to you, your family and to everyone. xxxx

author: local gran
title: Short stay Cardiology ward
body:
Was admitted to Cardiology from CAU for short stay, was seen straight away by Cardiology Consultant Dr Shearer who informed I was to have a CT angiogram moreorless straight away and she explained every single detail of what would take place.  
After CT was completed Dr Shearer took a lot of time to explain results in a very easy to understand manner and also change in medication and the benefit this would have. Also a big thanks to all the staff on the ward, but hope they don‚Äôt mind if I single out Care assistant Alex for providing my feet with cosy slip proof socks! the care I received was first class and the rooms given to patients were spotless, meals were delicious especially the macaroni cheese! Again many thanks to all.  
Cardiology has a great team of doctors, nursing staff and Care Assistants

readBy.name: Elaine Smith's office, MSP for Central Scotland

author: Spa experience
title: I applaud each and every one of you.
body:
I was admitted to A&E, ITU then HDU. I can‚Äôt thank the paramedics, A&E consultant Dr Richard who I never met but he along with others saved my life. I was put on a ventilator and my sister who was also treated very well was told it could go either way, they couldn‚Äôt say if I would survive. When I was brought round I was terrified, had no idea what had happened or where I was. Each and every consultant, doctor, nurse and anyone I‚Äôve missed were so kind and caring and not judgmental in any way.  
I applaud each and every one of you and thank you from the bottom of my heart. I also want to apologise if I was a difficult Patient which I‚Äôm sure I was. I still have no memory of what happened.  
Stay safe and I hope you all get the recognition, pay and working conditions that I think you so very much deserve when this virus is under control.  
Staying home and practicing social distancing is such a small price to pay to keep our NHS and Heroes safe.  
Thank you.

author: Hotem
title: Care for my husband suffering from Cellulitis
body:
My husband suffered a serious episode of Cellulitis resulting in him being admitted to hospital. After 4 days in hospital he was discharged. Unfortunately the Cellulitis did not improve & his GP decided that the Hospital At Home service would be best able to deal with his on-going treatment.  
Absolutely everything about this service was wonderful, from the initial assessment visit to my husband being deemed fit for discharge back to the care of his GP.  
The doctor & all the nurses were so caring & thoroughly professional, explaining everything clearly & carefully. They listened to any of our concerns & addressed them, giving lots of advice. They also phoned to check that everything was ok on days when there was no scheduled visit.  
All of this gave us a comforting sense of confidence.  
Many thanks to all concerned.
